channel.title: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]
channel.description:
Hey guys, I am trying to add a SplashScreen to a 317 client, made a SplashScreen.java file, and added a function to my client.java file to get to the SplashScreen itself. I just did that. Notthing else. Compiling gives me an error, and since I am new to programming, I have no frikkin' idea what it means.
Screenshot :
[img]http://i.imgur.com/cAeRcwu.png[/img]
I added a function in my client.java as I said, here is where I pasted it :
[code] public static void main(String args[]) { SplashScreen splash = new SplashScreen(); splash.showSplash();[/code]
Any help?

item.title: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

My bad, uppit dl link : http://uppit.com/te36hgf5g82e/client.java

Read full topic
item.source: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]

item.title: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:5, topic:552351”]Couldn’t post the code in a reply, put it in pastebin.

http://pastebin.com/mbmgphRP < There it is.

And here is the SplashScreen.java

[code]import java.awt.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

/**

  • SplashScreen - Shows splash screen and starts client.

*/
public class SplashScreen extends JWindow {

/**
 * Splash screen duration (milliseconds).
 */
private static int splashDuration = 5000;

/**
 * Splash screen image.
 */
private static String fileUrl = "URL HERE";

/**
 * The dimensions of the splash screen.
 */
private static int[] dimensions = {650, 400};

/**
 * Shows splash screen in the center of desktop.
 */
public static void showSplash() {
	Image image = null;
    	try {
        		URL url = new URL(fileUrl);
       		image = ImageIO.read(url);
   		} catch (Exception e) {
    		e.printStackTrace();
    	}

    	JFrame frame = new JFrame();
	frame.setUndecorated(true);
	frame.getRootPane().setWindowDecorationStyle(JRootPane.NONE);
    	frame.setSize(dimensions[0], dimensions[1]);
	Dimension dim = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize();
	frame.setLocation(dim.width / 2 - frame.getSize().width / 2, dim.height / 2 - frame.getSize().height / 2);
    	JLabel label = new JLabel(new ImageIcon(image));
    	frame.add(label);
    	frame.setVisible(true);

	try { Thread.sleep(splashDuration); } catch (Exception e) {}
	frame.setVisible(false);
}

}[/code][/quote]the paste is missing 99.9% of the class, try again…
also why are you even trying to do this, it’s just annoying to the user. it isnt functioning as a splash screen should, but w/e

Read full topic
item.source: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]

item.title: Unreachable statement error in java, help? [noob programmer]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

Couldn’t post the code in a reply, put it in pastebin.

http://pastebin.com/mbmgphRP < There it is.

And here is the SplashScreen.java

[code]import java.awt.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

/**

  • SplashScreen - Shows splash screen and starts client.

*/
public class SplashScreen extends JWindow {

/**
 * Splash screen duration (milliseconds).
 */
private static int splashDuration = 5000;

/**
 * Splash screen image.
 */
private static String fileUrl = "URL HERE";

/**
 * The dimensions of the splash screen.
 */
private static int[] dimensions = {650, 400};

/**
 * Shows splash screen in the center of desktop.
 */
public static void showSplash() {
	Image image = null;
    	try {
        		URL url = new URL(fileUrl);
       		image = ImageIO.read(url);
   		} catch (Exception e) {
    		e.printStackTrace();
    	}

    	JFrame frame = new JFrame();
	frame.setUndecorated(true);
	frame.getRootPane().setWindowDecorationStyle(JRootPane.NONE);
    	frame.setSize(dimensions[0], dimensions[1]);
	Dimension dim = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize();
	frame.setLocation(dim.width / 2 - frame.getSize().width / 2, dim.height / 2 - frame.getSize().height / 2);
    	JLabel label = new JLabel(new ImageIcon(image));
    	frame.add(label);
    	frame.setVisible(true);

	try { Thread.sleep(splashDuration); } catch (Exception e) {}
	frame.setVisible(false);
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

public static void main(String args[]) { SplashScreen splash = new SplashScreen(); splash.showSplash(); }

Aren’t you missing a close bracket?
